body_html:
@csarofeen I know why test_timeout fails locally now:

  1. Timeout is triggered. (Some) worker is still waiting to get, holding the get_lock.
  2. In __del__, for q in self.index_queues: q.shutdown() tries to acquire the lock, causing the hang.

So this locking mechanism seems quite unsafe if main process has some error. :O

body:
@csarofeen I know why test_timeout fails locally now:
1. Timeout is triggered. (Some) worker is still waiting to get, holding the `get_lock`.
2. In `__del__`, `for q in self.index_queues: q.shutdown()` tries to acquire the lock, causing the hang.

So this locking mechanism seems quite unsafe if main process has some error. :O
